content: What I needed. I was actually going to just program my own web based match scoring system, but found this which suited my needs except for one suggestion. I play riichi/Japanese Mahjong often with my friends. We would usually play East round only matches since East/South round matches can take a very long time to play out. Especially if you don't have an automatic mahjong table. When "adding" a Japanese Modern match, can you put in the options a way to set the match as an East only match?
replyContent:
Thank you for the feedback. :)
Good idea - I'll add in that option shortly!

content: Brilliantly helpful, and incredibly responsive to fixing any issues - thank you for an excellent app and astonishing customer service!
replyContent: My apologies. Please check for v5.721 which should fix the problem. :)

content: Waste of money wont let you put in your hands its false advertising
replyContent: Hmm, what hands are you trying to input that it won't let you?

content: Cannot score special hands or knitted hands.
replyContent: Hello; knitted hands are available if you set the match to use Chinese Official under the Match settings. Could that be the problem here?

content: Very good app. Very useful, i found out that the tanki/kanchan/ryanmen fu is called "out on one chance chi". It is great that I can manually adjust scores per hand, but automatic chombo penalties would be very useful to have especially for newer players like me. I would give it 4,5/5 stars since its missing a feature i would like but otherwise 5 stars

LOVE THE APP! The app is very good. Its definitely worth paying for the premium BUT PLEASE. I AM BEGGING YOU. The way you have to select the photo and slide to the tile you need is VERY UNINTUITIVE. PLEASE just make it a row of tiles with each corresponding suit. Also, maybe in the future you guys could put in the Japanese Romanji for the yakus in Japanese Modern ruleset?

The buttons for the tiles are way too small and I don't like how they are "hidden". It doesnt show the yaku and it wouldnt let me put in multiple pairs for a chitoiitsu Edit: I had the wrong rule set selected, now it works like I thought it would.
replyContent:
Hmm, could you email me a screenshot? Which ruleset were you using? (Some don't allow for 7 Pairs... It might be that you don't have Japanese modern selected?)
Thanks.

content: Great app, makes scoring so much easier. Pleasant interface. Sometimes it feels a little confusing to use, or that the score doesn't seem to update properly if you go back and change the app. Worth the price if you need help scoring hands in person.
buttons are a bit small
Has no room for scoring fu from the final tile. Or dora/red tiles.
replyContent: Dora + Red tiles are supported, please be sure that your Match settings have "Japanese Modern" selected. Final tile points are determined from the Winning Condition check-boxes (eg. "Won on Pair"). Hope that helps. :)

content: This one is the best available. With great support from developper. I tested it, it works great. I tested some other APP, all of them have issues.
The best mahjong scoring app on the market.
perfect for our three player Riichi games
Big help to me in learning the game
why has everything gone really small since the last update on 19th April?
replyContent:
Sorry for the problem. The latest version (5.620.1) resolves the UI size issues.
Thanks for using Mahjong Helper!

content: Well worth the 2.50

The best way to make scoring easy, and to add a bit more 
interest/competition to casual/fun playing. Having played Mahjong regually 
for decades, mostly for fun and not bothering with scoring this app has 
changed that!
The author is very responsive to reviews. For better service, tweet him directly @mahjonghelper. He fixed some bugs within 1 day of me filing them!! Thanks.
replyContent: Sorry about the bugs, but thanks for letting me know about them so I could address them. Glad you like the update! :)

content: Best scoring app on any app store. Worth the money!! Would suggest a list of all "fans" on the with the score explanation to help teach new players
Very very good app! A must-have tool for mahjong players! Very useful indeed.

Amazing app! It's the easiest score keep/assist for any ruleset available in Google Play. Absolutely well worth the download after I've tried so many other apps. Customization within the app is also impressive, going even down to font colors. Support from the developer is AMAZING as well - they're extremely timely with bug fixes and responses to any issues - fixed my complaint issue within a few days - don't make a mistake and choose another, you've already found the best one here.
replyContent: Thanks for the kind words, I'm glad you like the app! :)

content: Great app for scoring mahjong.
replyContent:
Hi Alyssa,
Glad you like the app. It is indeed eligible for Family Sharing… Google Play displays it as such, although the purchase date is a factor. (That said, I always appreciate every purchase!) ;)
Thanks. :)

content: Great program to help you keep score. It just works. Fast email feedback from the developers.
Once over the fairly small learning curve, makes scoring so much easier especially for Japanese rules
The only thing missing is a way to score a hand of 7 pairs.
replyContent:
Hi Adam,

You should be able to score 7 pairs (in Japanese Modern), but note you will only be able to add more than one pair if you add them in the "Concealed" zone (you are allowed one pair in the "Exposed" zone, if you won with a discard).

Email me a screenshot & other details if you think I've missed something. Hope that helps!

content: Could you please add 2 player's and 5 player's thank you for any help great app and could you add a quick ade so we get to know what the different hands mean and there values are ie chow pung pong ect
replyContent:
Glad you like!

2P mode is planned, still trying to figure out how best to handle it though. (eg. 2P-Riichi might benefit from a new set of tools)

For 5P, do you mean with a "dreamer" (person who rotates in), or a "bettor"?

I am planning on adding a "hand reference" for Japanese, & score ref. for Classical & HK modes. :)

Thanks for the feedback!

content: Wonderful app that takes the spadework out of the s coring and means scoring can finally be used without everyone complaining about how complicated it all is! Voice input seems absent on Android, and a few more customization options would be great, e.g. player photos or custom colours ( my gf's input :)).
replyContent:
Thank you so much, I'm glad you like the app! :)

Voice input is a bit trickier on Android (and iOS) than on WP8 given how I've built the app, but I will give it another look. Thanks also for the customization option ideas, I'll see what I can do for a future update (couple other things I want to do first, but it's in the queue! :)  )

content: This app is JUST what you need if you play mahjong with friends. Good interface, easy to use, all the functions you may need. I'm throwing my payment tables away :D
Work pretty well keep track of score and adding up score. It sometimes get buggy.
replyContent: Thanks for the rating+review. If you come across bugs please email me and I'll try my best to address them. :)

content: Works great on my galaxy s3, and Acer Iconia A100. Makes scoring so much easier. Thanks for the update!
replyContent:
Thanks for the feedback. Sorry about the problem on the A100, though. (So many different Android devices!). Can you email me what version of Android is it running maybe?  Thanks.

(Or… maybe 2.35 will have fixed the issue?  I upgraded the framework to a newer version which might perform better)

content: Looking pretty good!  I haven't tested extensively yet, but two things I just noticed:  1) The target "buttons" for assembling the hand don't look like buttons at all.  I thought it was some stylish filler wallpaper until I accidentally tapped it.  You may want to draw some hard lines or something in there so it's clear that you can touch it, and that it's not just art.  2) The toggle switches for settings like open tanyao sometimes instantly revert.  I got it to work by touching and holding briefly instead of quickly tapping on them.
replyContent:
Hello and thanks. :)
1) I wanted a way to select tiles quickly with as few taps as possible, & settled on the touch-slide-release interface w/ different targets for the suit.  However, I agree it's a little abstract. v2.35 adds a "hint" animation if no tiles selected.
2) v2.35 should hopefully fix the problem with the toggle-switches "reverting".
